title: importing/exporting old mails to a new device
content:
How do I get mail from the 'sent' folder on an old laptop into a new one? I have migrated old received mail and contacts to the new inbox no problem.

Using the export tool is no use - the Zip folder it creates titled 'Thunderbird_profile_backup' is corrupted and nothing can open it. I manually copied all files into an external drive and opened them in the new Thunderbird. That imported contacts but not mail from the old 'sent' folder. How do I get all those old sent mails out of the old device?

title: Thunderbird times out when sending emails
content:
Good morning. I need help with sending emails in Thunderbird. The problem has existed for a couple of days now and is confusing as some emails are sent and others fail. I am receiving mail OK. Details of my setup are :- I am using a HP All-in-one desktop running Windows 11 with Norton 360. My Thunderbird account settings: Server type: IMAP mail server User name: ****@gmail.com Server name: imap.gmail.com Port: 993 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication: OAuth2 Outgoing Server (SMTP): Google Mail – smtp.gmail.com (Default) User name: ****@gmail.com Port: 465 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication: OAuth2

The problem: I only recently set up Thunderbird and at first it seemed to working OK. However, now when I try to send a message, after some time, I the following error message :-

"Send Error Message Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com timed out. Try again."

What is particularly confusing is that some messages are being sent. I have tried several fixes that I found from the Mozilla, Google and Norton web sites but none of the fixes resolved the issue. Any assistance would be very much appreciated.

Regards Mike

PS: I have 2 email accounts set up in Thunderbird. I just tried sending a test message from the Gmail account to the Bigpond account. From the Gmail account it appears to have been sent but in the Bigpond account an error message appeared as follows :-

"Could not connect to the mail server smtp.telstra.com; the connection was refused."

I don't know if this is a related issue or I have another one to resolve.
creator: MikeF48

title: TB takes forever bringing inbox up to date
content:
Using TB 115.11.0 (32-bit) on a Windows 10 machine, with IMAP synchronization. Quite often (but not always) the synchronization of the inbox takes an extremely long time, Activity Manager showing "bringing folder inbox up to date" hanging in "downloading message 1 of ...".

I have made a Gecko IMAP:5 log and see (during this state) a pattern repeating every 2 minutes, ending in "idle mode async waiting". Then, after a long time suddenly the synchronization process finishes.

What can be wrong here?

title: Problema "autenticazione richiesta" Thunderbird
content:
Buongiorno a tutti, le ho provate tutte ma non riesco a risolvere un problema!

Sul PC in questione (Windows 11) ho configurato su Thunderbird 115.10.1 (32 bit) due caselle di posta elettronica (una che si chiama "acquisti" ed una che si chiama "segreteria") con dominio personalizzato di "aruba".

Ormai da tanti mesi appare in continuazione la schermata (che Vi allego) di richiesta di autenticazione.

Anche se inserisco correttamente user e password e mettendo la spunta su "utilizzare ...", la schermata torna a comparire. Se faccio click su "annulla" la schermata scompare (e la posta funziona), per poi ricomparire dopo un po'.

La posta viene scaricata ed inviata correttamente da tutti gli indirizzi e-mail configurati ed il problema si presenta solo su questo PC.

Ho controllato la correttezza dei dati di configurazione dell'account (sia POP3 che SMTP) ma risulta tutto corretto. Ho cancellato la cache, pulito dai file temporanei, le ho provate tutte ma il problema persiste.

Attendo vs. aiuto. Grazie a tutti in anticipo!

P.S. Ho provato anche ad avviare in modalità "provvisoria" senza componenti aggiuntivi: mi da lo stesso problema! Mi dava lo stesso problema anche con le precedenti versioni di Thunderbird. Preciso anche che è sincronizzata una rubrica condivisa CardDav.
creator: alessiazambelli

title: Can I make messages pane look like Betterbird?
content:
I us an M2 Mac. I like Thunderbird, but prefer the Betterbird card view. Is there any way I can replicate this in Thunderbird?

I have attached two screenshots - one Betterbird, the other Thunderbird. I much prefer the Betterbird look, without the card frames and with the blue message header.

You might well say 'use Betterbird then!'. The problem is that Betterbird is not available in a native Apple Silicon version, only Intel, and therefore runs in emulation mode. Thunderbird has a native Apple Silicon version.

Just two small changes. Remove the card frame and make the unread message header blue. Surely that's possible somehow in Thunderbird?
creator: phillip9

title: I am trying to send emails from a VBA code, and it works sometimes and sometimes not.
content:
My code is as follows: thund = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe " & _ 

       "-compose " & """" & _        "to='" & email & "'," & _        "attachment='" & Attachment$ & "'," & _        "subject='" & subj & "'," & _        "body='" & fullBody$ & "'" & """"    Call Shell(thund, vbNormalFocus)    Sleep 3000    AppActivate "thunderbird"    SendKeys "^~", True    Sleep 3000 
   SendKeys "^{ENTER}", True    Sleep 3000 
   SendKeys "%fd", True

title: File temporaneo NSTMP su IMAP Gmail
content: Buongiono, Sta capitando che Thunderbird crei questi file temporanei "NSTMP" con molta frequenza anche con dimensioni molto corporsi (15gb, un altro a 50Gb, ecc...) Prima di scrivere ho anche cercato in vari forum e dicono che questi file si potrebbero anche cancellare con il programma non aperto. Solo che una volta cancellato uno dei tanti creati file "NSTMP", (creando una copia di sicurezza in esterno) ho notato che 4 mail (per ora quelle viste) di Gmail sono in posta in arrivo ma senza corpo messaggio o allegato, quindi bianche. Mentre sul server del sito di Gmail ci sono e sono consultabili. Ora mi chiedo: Thurderbird con la nuova sicronizzazione (la barra comunica oltre 8.000 mail in entrata) non è che va a cancellare il database IMAP presente nell'albero? quindi Posta ricevuta ed inviata? Anche perchè il database primario IMAP di Gmail è rimasto intatto senza essere eliminato dalla cartella madre creata dal progamma. Aspetto una risposta Grazie Luca Di Santo

title: Need to change associated email address
content:
The email address that I have used ever since email began has been [edited] @qis.net. Unfortunately, the inbox storage space on Quantum Internet Service (QIS) is only 1GB. I use Thunderbird for emails (recommended by QIS). The account with QIS is an IMAP account.

Yesterday at 4:40pm my inbox became full even though I have moved a bunch of the emails with larger attachments to offline folders within Thunderbird. That's when the nightmare started. No incoming emails can get delivered at this time. Have been in contact with QIS (I personally know everyone there including the owners. They're good people) It seems that we do not have a way to get into the inbox and remove files from their server (s).

After working all night trying to sole this mess, I have set up a new email address to maintain a form of communications on a major engineering project.

The new email address for me should be changed to : [edited] @gmail.com

Please make this change at Firefox. When I try to login on Firefox, it sends a code to the old, non-usable email address. Since the inbox at QIS is full, I can't read it to get the code to respond. If the code can be sent SMS to my cell phone, that would be fine. [removed phone# from public support forum] is the number to use.

I hope all this makes some sense at your end. I am not a guru with this stuff and a very dear friend of mine who was an "IT guru", as I called him, has passed away about 1 year ago.

I appreciate any help you give.

Richard Slechter
creator: rjslechter.gilro
